title: Never Go to Ground
author: VD
content_html:
It’s just a pity that all the whites who smugly proclaim their color-blindness and anti-racism can’t be subject to an actual experience of a black pack attack, as I expect it would be educational in the extreme.

The video is a good example of why you should never go to ground, either in defense or if you’re a Brazilian Jiu-Jitsu master. It’s essentially an invitation to get repeatedly kicked in the head. It’s also why you should always wear a belt, as looping it around an attacker’s neck gives you instant control over them and allows you to use their body as a shield. It also puts a timer on the crowd’s ability to attack without consequence, since unconsciousness can result within as little as ten seconds. Quickly taking out the leader tends to disincentivize the rest of the pack.

However, whites need to realize that no other culture believes in “a fair fight” or the Marquis of Queensbury rules, and that trying to “break things up” is always a mistake, because any involvement will be immediately viewed as enemy action. Look at how the woman ended up getting KO’d at the end and taking worse damage than the guy getting beat up for nearly two solid minutes. Where we go one, we go all, so if your friend is being attacked, you’d better get stuck in and even the odds before it’s 10-on-1.

And for the love of the sweet science and self-defense, stay in motion and pay attention to your six!
